publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-363 Eleanor Scott: Hi-Arts Broadband Britain Challenge Awardâ€”That the Parliament congratulates Hi-Arts on winning the public sector category of the Broadband Britain Challenge Awards; notes the diversity of the arts and their pivotal role in our cultural identity and our economy, and welcomes the potential that broadband offers to offset some of the difficulties faced by arts makers and other small businesses in remote and rural areas and thereby support sustainable development in those areas.

S2M-363 Eleanor Scott: Hi-Arts Broadband Britain Challenge Award-That the Parliament congratulates Hi-Arts on winning the public sector category of the Broadband Britain Challenge Awards; notes the diversity of the arts and their pivotal role in our cultural identity and our economy, and welcomes the potential that broadband offers to offset some of the difficulties faced by arts makers and other small businesses in remote and rural areas and thereby support sustainable development in those areas.
S2M-363 Hi-Arts Broadband Britain Challenge Award (lodged on 18 September 2003) Shiona Baird*, Mr Rob Gibson*, Mark Ballard*, Alex Neil*
S2M-363 Hi-Arts Broadband Britain Challenge Award (lodged on 18 September 2003) Chris Ballance*, Patrick Harvie*, Robin Harper*, Maureen Macmillan*
S2M-363 Hi-Arts Broadband Britain Challenge Award (lodged on 18 September 2003) Mary Scanlon*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-363 Hi-Arts Broadband Britain Challenge Award (lodged on 18 September 2003) Cathy Peattie*, Margo MacDonald*, Mr Mark Ruskell*
S2M-363 Hi-Arts Broadband Britain Challenge Award (lodged on 18 September 2003) Dr Jean Turner*
